techmeme.title: Founders Tim Berners-Lee and Rosemary Leith announce the World Wide Web Foundation is shutting down after fifteen years of fighting to make the web safer (Thomas Claburn/The Register)
A US judge temporarily blocks California's AG from enforcing AB 2839 on election deepfakes, which Gov. Gavin Newsom signed into law on September 17 (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
The SEC files a notice of appeal in its Ripple case, seeking to reverse a July 2023 ruling that XRP sales on retail exchanges didn't violate securities law (Nikhilesh De/CoinDesk)
Biden signs legislation exempting some US semiconductor manufacturing facilities that are receiving government subsidies from federal environmental reviews (David Shepardson/Reuters)
Accenture says it will train 30K employees on Nvidia's AI technologies and start a new Nvidia Business Group focused on driving enterprise adoption of AI agents (Dylan Martin/CRN)
